com.gej.util

Class GUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.util.GUtil

  • public final class GUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Some of the utilities needed by the engine. Note that all the utility methods are static. This class is necessary for the engine to run. The class is made abstract to prevent the user from instantiation.
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

      • isCollision

        public static boolean isCollision(float x1,
                  float y1,
                  float w1,
                  float h1,
                  float x2,
                  float y2,
                  float w2,
                  float h2)
        Checks if two rectangles intersect each other at a high speed than the Rectangle class. This is also accurate since the collision detection is done if four stages.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The upper-left x-coordinate of the first rectangle
        y1 - The upper-left y-coordinate of the first rectangle
        w1 - The width of the first rectangle
        h1 - The height of the first rectangle
        x2 - The upper-left x-coordinate of the second rectangle
        y2 - The upper-left y-coordinate of the second rectangle
        w2 - The width of the second rectangle
        h2 - The height of the second rectangle
        Returns:
        True if the two rectangles intersect each other

      • isPixelPerfectCollision

        public static boolean isPixelPerfectCollision(float x1,
                              float y1,
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image1,
                              float x2,
                              float y2,
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image2)
        Check's for pixel-perfect collision between two buffered images.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-position of the first object
        y1 - The y-position of the first object
        image1 - The buffered image of first object
        x2 - The x-position of the second object
        y2 - The y-position of the second object
        image2 - The buffered image of second object
        Returns:
        True if a collision has been found

        Parameters:

        y1 - The ordinate of first point

        y2 - The ordinate of second point
        Returns:

      • chance

        public static boolean chance(int sides)
        You specify the number of sides of a dice which is then thrown. Then if the dice lands on one, the result is true and the next action is performed. This can be used to put an element of randomness in your game. For example, in each step you can generate with a particular chance a bomb or a change of direction. The larger the number of sides of the dice, the smaller the chance.
        Parameters:
        sides - The number of sides of the dice
        Returns:
        True if the dice lands on one else false

      • getDirection

        public static int getDirection(float x1,
               float y1,
               float x2,
               float y2)
        Returns the inclination of the line-segment drawn from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) in degrees
        Parameters:

        y1 - The ordinate of first point
        x2 - The abscissa of second point
        y2 - The ordinate of second point
        Returns:
        The direction in degrees
